description.lang: Aeon Labs Smart Switch Gen5 is a Z-Wave device that can report the wattage energy usage and KWH usage to a Z-Wave Controller (especially a gateway), it can be controlled by other Z-Wave devices to turn on/off loads, it can bear up to 16A current of resistive loads. It also acts as a repeater that forwards Z-Wave command messages to destination nodes if the originating controller is out of range from the destination node.By taking advantage of the Z-Wave mesh network, commands can be routed to their destination via intermediary listening Z-Wave products. Products that are Z-Wave certified can be used and communicate with other Z-Wave certified devices.Also a tool that can be programmed, scheduled, controlled and communicated with from anywhere in the world.

Group 1 is assigned to the Lifeline association group and every device has 5 nodes to associate.When the switch is turned on or off using the action button, the switch will send a basic report of its status to the nodes in association group 1. To change what kind of signal is sent to the nodes in group 1, please see the detailed description of configuration parameter 80.

When the product receives a controlling Basic Set CC/Switch Binary Set CC/ Scene Activation Set CC, which if cause the products load state to be changed, which will lead to send the Basic Set CC/Switch Binary Set CC /Scene Activation Set CC to nodes in group 2.

name.lang: To set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 1.The values corresponding to the first four bits of the parameter value may be combined to create different combinations of reports that you wish to have sent.For example, instantaneous Current is the value 2 and instantaneous Watts is the value 4, so setting parameter 101 to a value of 6 will result in both instantaneous Current and instantaneous Watts to be reported.See the full description of the parameter values for other possible settings.
Report Accumulated kWh
Report Instantaneous Current (Amperes)
Report Instantaneous Watts
Report Instantaneous Voltage

name.lang: To set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 2.The values corresponding to the first four bits of the parameter value may be combined to create different combinations of reports that you wish to have sent.For example, instantaneous Current is the value 2 and instantaneous Watts is the value 4, so setting parameter 102 to a value of 6 will result in both instantaneous Current and instantaneous Watts to be reported.See the full description of the parameter values for other possible settings.
Report Instantaneous Voltage
Report Instantaneous Watts
Report Accumulated kWh
Report Instantaneous Current (Amperes)

name.lang: To set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 3.The values corresponding to the first four bits of the parameter value may be combined to create different combinations of reports that you wish to have sent.For example, instantaneous Current is the value 2 and instantaneous Watts is the value 4, so setting parameter 103 to a value of 6 will result in both instantaneous Current and instantaneous Watts to be reported.See the full description of the parameter values for other possible settings.
Report Instantaneous Voltage
Report Instantaneous Current (Amperes)
Report Instantaneous Watts
Report Accumulated kWh

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 1. (The unit of time is second).
Interval Seconds

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 2. (The unit of time is second).
Interval Seconds

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 3. (The unit of time is second).
Interval Seconds
This parameter is used for customer to control the products load (e. g incandescent light) to blink with a certain time when you set this parameter and send this command to the load.
Specify the time that Smart Switch should blink, in seconds.
Specifies the cycle of on/off, the unit of it is 0.1 second.
This parameter is used to configure the partner ID. (0== Aeon Labs Standard Product, 1~255== others).
Aeon Labs Standard Product
Partner ID of Partner Product
This parameter is used to enable/disable Lock all configuration parameters.(0 =disable, 1 = enable)
All configuration parameters are configurable.
All configuration parameters are not configurable (Locked).
This parameter is used to save the device tag, which will be written/ assigned in factory/ manufacturer.
Device Tag
This parameter is used to reset product to default factory setting. (There are just 2 values can be used).
Reset the product to default factory setting and be excluded from the Z-wave network.
Resets all configuration parameters to default setting.
This parameter is used for the overload protection, which means the load will be disconnected after 2 minutes when the current more than 15.5A.
Overload Protection Disabled
Overload Protection is Enabled

name.lang: Enable/Disable to send notifications to associated devices to associated devices.

description.lang: This parameter is used to Enable/Disable to send notifications to associated devices (in Group 1) when the state of Smart Switch Gen5s load is changed. (0=Send nothing, 1=Send hail CC, 2=Send basic report CC).
Send Nothing (Disabled)
Send HAIL Command
Send BASIC Report Command

name.lang: Enable/Disable the function of parameter 91 and 92.

description.lang: This parameter is used to Enable/Disable the function of parameter 91 and 92 (1=Enabled, 0=Disabled).
Configuration Parameters 91 and 92 are Disabled
Configuration Parameters 91 and 92 are Enabled
This parameter is used to induce an automatic report when the change of the current power is more/less than the threshold in wattage.
The threshold can be set from 0 to 32767 watt.
This parameter is used to induce an automatic report when the change of the current power is more/less than the threshold in percentage.
The threshold can be set from 0 to 100 percent.
